data.title: A Strategy for e-Training in Information Technology Security
data.meta_description: This research aimed to develop e-Training Strategy for Information Technology Security Model which included 5 steps; Step 1-Depth interview of 8 e-Training Strategy Experts. Step 2-Analysis and synthesis of data and information obtained from expert
data.text:
The paper focuses on creating an internet security awareness training program for use by students at the Metropolitan State University of Denver. The discussion begins with analyzing the best practices of the current security programs. Also, the paper outlines some of the challenges of creating the training program for the university's students.

We know that many e-learning institutions are rushing into adopting ICT without carefully planning and understanding any related security concerns. E-learning is a new method of learning which ultimately depends on the Internet in its execution. The Internet has become the venue for a new set of illegal activities, and the e-learning environment is now exposed to such threats. In this paper, e-learning context, definition, characteristics, development, growth, benefits and challenges are all elaborated upon. This paper discusses the security elements required to be implemented within e-learning environments. In addition, the paper explains the situation and existing research relating to security in e-learning. Furthermore, information security management is suggested to contribute to preparing a secured e-learning environment.

The article considers the peculiarities of using the Internet as an educational resource. The author analyzes the advantages and disadvantages of implementation Internet technologies into the educational process. It is noted that the effective use of educational Internet resources depends on the availability of ITT tools, their technical level, the ability of users to efficiently search and use of the necessary educational and reference resources at different stages of the educational process.
